text: Starting the discussion here on chat backup options. How do we want to approach cloud vs local storage?
<@U9101> Good start. Maybe we prioritize cloud first, then local later?
Yeah, let's finalize Google Drive and Dropbox first, then add local storage as an option in the next sprint.
Agreed. For local, we can allow users to export chat data to their device directly.
I'll create a design for the export feature. It should be intuitive and easy to use.
Sounds like a plan. Let's aim to have cloud backup ready for testing by the end of the week.
I'll update the project board with these tasks and deadlines. Thanks for the discussion!
**Reminder:** Don't forget to back up your chat data! It's important to keep your conversations safe.
Yes, a notification system for success and failure is a must. I'll handle that.
I'll work on the UI for selecting backup destinations. We need a seamless experience here.
Agreed! I’ll start drafting the API for cloud and local backup options.
We should also consider local storage backup for users who prefer that.
What about encryption? We should ensure all backups are encrypted.
I'll update the UI mockups to include a notification icon for backup status.
We should make use of the same notification framework as the other app features to keep things consistent.
Should we also notify users when a backup is complete or failed?
I'll work on the UI for selecting backup destinations. We need a seamless experience here.
Agreed! I’ll start drafting the API for cloud and local backup options.
We should also consider local storage backup for users who prefer that.
Agreed! I’ll start drafting the API for cloud and local backup options.
I'll work on the UI for selecting backup destinations. We need a seamless experience here.
Should we also notify users when a backup is complete or failed?
Yes, a notification system for success and failure is a must. I'll handle that.
I'll work on the UI for selecting backup destinations. We need a seamless experience here.
We should also consider local storage backup for users who prefer that.
